items.question: Do I need to avoid eating in front of someone fasting?
items.answer: No. You don't need to hide eating or drinking. Just avoid repeatedly offering food or making it a big deal.

items.question: Can I say 'Ramadan Mubarak'?
items.answer: Yes â€” it's a kind greeting. Keep it simple and don't force a conversation.

items.question: Why are some Muslims not fasting?
items.answer: Ramadan looks different for different people. Some are exempt, some choose not to fast, some fast some days. Don't ask for personal reasons.

items.question: What time of day is hardest?
items.answer: It varies, but late afternoon can feel harder for some. If you can, schedule heavy work earlier.

items.question: What are the last ten nights?
items.answer: Many Muslims increase worship in the last ten nights and may stay up later. Planning flexibility during this period can help.

items.question: Are prayer breaks allowed at work?
items.answer: Many workplaces accommodate this via flexible breaks or a quiet space. The best approach is a private, respectful conversation based on role needs.
